Title.evidence: Development of Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Guidelines for Colorectal Cancer: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual study

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies targeting colorectal cancer surgeries

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved the application of ERAS protocols, while the comparator was standard postoperative care

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of postoperative complications, measured within 30 days post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified

Result_Outcome.evidence: significant reductions in postoperative complication rates observed in the intervention group (odds ratio [OR], 0.70; 95% confidence interval [CI], 0.51 to 0.97)
